abilityText.value: For targeting purposes, treat Inhabited terrain tiles as if they were Titans
If a terrain tile is attacked, it is immediately destroyed
Do not resolve an Evasion Roll
Despair tokens apply the following stacking penalties (on top of their regular effects): 1+ token: You cannot use Mnemos cards
2+ tokens: You cannot use exhaustable
Gear
3+ tokens: You cannot perform
MovementAction
The D letters on the Primordial Diagram mark the Danger Zone spaces
If a Titan moves through or into the Danger Zone during the Titan Round, roll a d10
On a 7+, they manage to get through
Otherwise, they gain +2
Danger
Ignore this Trait during a Cyclonus Attack
As the Chimera moves, it leaves behind a trail of black Ambrosia
After the Chimera ends its movement, place an
Ambrosia Trail
tile directly behind it
The Chimera always moves its full
Speed
value and that movement is considered a
Pushback
The Pushback applies to the Target, as well as every Titan adjacent to the Chimera at the start of the move
If the Target is on the VP, the Chimera still moves in the direction it is currently facing
Titanwall:
All Titans affected by Pushback can collectively use all effects that mitigate it
Nobody Stops:
If the Pushback value is reduced below 3, the Chimera gains a positive Speed token
The Chimera's Ambrosia is highly toxic and volatile
During this Battle, all Titans suffer the following penalty:
Level 2-3:
Ambrosia Limit -1
Level 4-6: Ambrosia Limit -2
Level 7+: Ambrosia Limit -3
Remove the
Sisyphean Task
AI card from the Battle
Add the 3
Sisyphean (Special)
Condition cards (Secret deck 8, cards 144-146) to the game
When you deal a Wound, discard a
Sisyphean
Condition card from your Titan
Additional Setup: Each Titan gains a Sisyphean Condtion card (randomly distributed the 4 Sisyphean Condition cards between them)
At the start of a Titan's turn, they must place their Time Anchor on their space
Move it from its previous location if necessary
When a Primordial Attack deals
Fate
, it triggers a Trauma Draw (just like dealing
Danger
would)
If an Attack deals both
Fate
and
Danger
, resolve only one Trauma Draw
Being dealt
Fate
over 9 does not cause a Moiros draw (it causes an Obol draw instead)
Whenever a Titan resolves a Trauma Draw, consult their Trauma Table and draw a Trauma card of a severity corresponding with their current
Danger
or
Fate
value (whichever is higher)
The track on this sheet represents the
Icarian Adaptation Board
If you Wound the Icarian Harpy, after resolving Responses, place an Adaptation token on the Icarian Adaptation Board, on a space corresponding to your Weapon class
If there are no more Adaptation tokens outside of the Adaptation Board, move one of the tokens form the Adaptation Board onto this space
Any attempt to Wound with a Weapon class listed on a space covered with an Adaptation token will automatically Fail
During attempts with a Weapon class listed on a space adjacent to an Adaptation token, the Icarian Harpy gains +1
AT
This bonus can stack if a space is adjacent to two Adaptation tokens
Additional Setup:
Place a designated number of generic tokens near the Icarian Adaptation Board
These are the Adaptation tokens
Level 1: 1 token
Level 2: 2 tokens
Level 3-4: 3 tokens
Level 5-6: 4 tokens
Level 7+: 5 tokens
Start of Battle
Starting from the highest
Danger
and continuing in descending order, Titans suffer:
Level 1:
Bleeding 2
, Bleeding 1
Level 2: Bleeding 2, Bleeding 2
Level 3: Bleeding 2, Bleeding 2, Bleeding 1
Level 4: Bleeding 3, Bleeding 2, Bleeding 2
WoO
End of Primordial Round
Titan with the most Bleeding tokens in Sight that has not been Attacked this Round becomes the Target of Predation
If there is no eligible Target, Predation doesn't trigger
If you reveal a BP card with a
AT
symbol as a result of a card or an ability effect (not during a normal BP Draw), gain
Fate
equal to the BP card's level
Remember: This Trait is added to every Battle in the game, regardless of the Primordial
During this Battle, you cannot use Hope tokens
Battle Setup
Add the
You died a beggar!
Obol (Secret deck 10, card 185) to the Obol deck
Remove it after the Battle concludes
If you roll a Crit Miss during the Attack Roll, during thie Attack, ignore
Potential
During Battle Aftermath, for the purposes of gaining resources, treat the Primordial as 1 level lower (to a minimum of 1)
Start of Battle
Discard 1
Energy
token from every Argo Ability
Unless Titans have at least one free
OneHanded
slot, whenever they would suffer Knockdown, they fall into the abyss and die instead
Normal (not Terrain) Battle Board spaces are considered Terrain tiles with the
Chasm
keyword
Each time Midascore gains Wound (a Double Wound counts as 2 Wounds), place a Midas token on this card
Each time a Titan discard Midas tokens, place them here
After resolving the current action, if there are 5 or more Midas tokens on this card, discard 5 of those tokens and perform Signature
Each time Demdjinn gains Wound (a Double Wound counts as 2 Wounds), place a token on this card
After resolving the current action, if there are 3 or more Midas tokens on this card, discard all tokens, then perform Signature
When instructed to remove an Irem Towre and there are no empty Irem Tower Terrain tiles, remove an Irem Tower with a Titan on it instead
Start of Primordial Round
If there are no Irem Tower Terrain tiles on the Battle Board, the Babelian Lunacy immediately wins the Battle
Otherwise, remove 4 Irem Tower Terrain tiles
Eclipse Attacks are additionally measured from an imaginary line drawn along th Rear spaces of the Babelian Lunacy
Start of Primordial Round
Pull 3 all Titans in Zone 6
The Babelian Lunacy does not move as a result of that Pull
End of Primordial Round
Knockback 6 all Titans in Zone 3 away from the Babelian Lunacy
When you gain Ambrosia tokens, if possible, place them on a single game element (
Gear
, Mnemos, etc
) with the Light X keyword that does not already have Ambrosia tokens on it
Those Ambrosia tokens still count toward your Ambrosia Limit
If a game element with Ambrosia tokens is discard for any reason, move the tokens to your Titan Sheet
Disable all Light X keywords on a game element with Ambrosia tokens on it
Each Titan starts the Battle with 2 Oxygen tokens
End of your turn
Flip 1 Oxygen token
If at any point you must flip or discard an Oxygen token and you don't have any, you die
If the Dragon of Phobos is outside of the Battle Board when drawing AI or performing Signature, instead of normal Targeting, use
Target:
Hierarchy
Instead of performing any movement instructions (like
WoO
Move & Attack):
if the space directly behind the Target is empty, appear behind the Target, if able
if that space is occupied, appear to the side, then front (even if occupied, stand Crash rules apply)
Finally, without moving, continue resolving the AI or Signature
Each time the Dragon of Phobos disappears or gains a Wound (a Double Wound is treated as 2 Wounds), place a token on this Trait
After resolving the current action, if there are 4 or more tokens on this Trait, discard all tokens, then draw and resolve the top AI card
For each dead Titan, reduce Vanish by 1
For each dead Titan, lower Scan Difficulty by 1
This replaces the
A Truth for a Truth
Trait
Each time the Dragon of Phobos disappears or gains a Wound (a Double Wound is treated as 2 Wounds), place a token on this Trait
After resolving the current action, if there are 3 or more tokens on this Trait, discard all tokens
The Dragon of Phobos disappears
Then, draw and resolve the top AI card
Meduketos starts the Battle outside of the Battle Board
When the Meduketos is outside of the Battle Board, it cannot be Targeted, unless from a VP
When the Meduketos attacks while outside of the Battle Board, it does so from the closest Board Edge to the Target, ignoring the initial
WoO
and any Move commands (in other words, the Meduketos stays outside of the Battle Board)
Lightbend:
The Meduketos disappears (remove the Primordial from the Battle Board)
If able, place a
Petrified Vent
Terrain tile on the center of its previous space
Triggers when prompted
Each time the Meduketos gains a Wound (a Double Wound is treated as 2 Wounds), unless it was dealt from a VP, place a token on this Trait
After resolving the current action, if there are 3 or more tokens on this Trait, discard all tokens, then
Lightbend
and create 1 Vantage Point, then draw and resolve the top AI card
Once per Titan Round, Titans may perform a Scane (see Cycle V Storybook, p
Choose a
Titan
and an
adjacent Petrified Vent
Terrain tile, then reveal the top Major Trauma card
This is called scanning a card
Instead of resolving the card, check the number in the lower left corner
If the
total
of
every scanned card
and the
Light X value
of the currently scanning Titan is
equal to or higher
than
the Scan Difficulty
, you have found the Meduketos! Immediately replace that Vent with the Meduketos (in any way), then perform
WoO
Skitter
If the total is lower, leave the Trauma card revealed and proceed to the next scanning Titan
Each Titan and each Vent may be chosen for a Scan only once per Round
End of Titan Round
Shuffle all Major Trauma cards back into the deck
The Scan Difficulty is equal to 8 + the Primordial level
At level IX, instead the Scan Difficulty is 18
If you have the Light X keyword, during a single movement, you may move through X spaces of a Black Abyss Terrain tile
In this way, you may end your movement on a Black Abyss space
When you move through or onto a Black Abyss tile, gain 1 Ambrosia token at the end of that movement
If a Titan starts its turn on a Black Abyss tile and doesn't move until the end of this turn, they gain 1 Ambrosia token
If at any point you do not have the Light X keyword while on a Black Abyss tile, you die
Relight:
When you deal a Wound, move X Ambrosia tokens from a game element with Light X to your Sheet, where X is the BP level
Apply the following modifiers to all Titan X Attacks: -1
and -1
Danger
per hit (minimum 1)
As long as this Trait is active, the
Death of Hope
Trait is disabled
Ur-Fleece has -1
AT
There is a flaw in the Nietzschean's technique! Find it and exploit it! Ignore the
Danger Sense
Trait when moving into the Weakspot space
CombatAction
When you are on a Weakspot space, perform a normal Attack, but do not draw a BP card
Perform the Power Roll, divide your Total Power by 2 (rounding up) and add +1 Power if you had a Crit Chance
Note the resulting Power, then clear the Kratos Pool and continue to your second ability window (do not resolve any responses)
Next time any Titan Attacks, it adds the Power you noted to its Total Power
Disable the
Stay Your Hand
Trait
End of Primordial Round: Titan with the lowest Danger gains X Danger
X is the current position of the Time marker
Start of Battle
Place this card in the Wound Stack
This card counts as X Wounds, where X is equal to 89 - Primordial level
Reference

When you attack a BP Ill (and only a BP Ill), proceed to resolve it as a normal Attack, but after performing the Power Roll, divide your Total Power by 2 (rounding up), add +1 if you had a Crit Chance, and then note the result
Do not Escalate and do not resolve any responses
Instead, Ur-Fleece
Flickers
Then, clear the Kratos Pool and continue to your second ability window
Finally, place the BP card on top of the BP deck
Note:
This does not count as a Wound!
The next
two
Titan attacks targeting this BP Ill will similarly add half of their Total Power to this growing
Ultimate Power
, following the above rules
The final,
fourth
Attack should be performed as a normal Attack, but add their full Total Power to this Ultimate Power
This means each subsequent Titan Attack is stronger than the last
If, during any of the four Attacks the Ultimate Power matches or beats the
GT
or
AT
of the BP card, you finally deal a Wound!
If any Titan attacks another BP card, erase the noted Power and ignore this effect
If you do not Wound the BP card with the fourth Attack in a row, do not note your Power, erase the noted Power and suffer the Fail or Instinct response instead!
Important: During the White Lie Battle see paragraph 8677, on p
70 for additional rules
Assign a Facing Indicator to each Titan X
During Titan X's turn, draw 3 AI cards and resolve them in order
Each Titan X has their own Wound Stack with 12
Wounds
Escalation happens every 3 Wounds
When you deal a Wound, place a Generic token on this card and a Generic Wound in the corresponding Titan X's Wound Stack
If there are already 2 tokens on this card, discard them, perform a normal Escalation, and place the BP on the corresponding Wound Stack instead
For full Setup and rules, see 7539 in Cycle V Storybook (p
You may add this card to any Hermesian Pursuer Battle to test yourself
Add the
Punctured
Trauma card to the Major Trauma deck
Replace the Signature with the new
Conquerer Strike
card
All Regular (non-Zone, non-Judgement, etc
) Attacks become Sequential Attacks with "Move and Attack All Titan in Path" and their "After Attack" becomes "After Final Attack"
Start of Battle
Assign a Time Anchor token to your Titan
Place it under your Titan
Start of your tunr
Move the Time Anchor 5 spaces in a random direction
If you draw a card with
ChooseDirection
, place the Time Anchor under your Titan instead of choosing a direction
If you start the Primordial Round or your Titan turn adjacent to the Pitiless, you are incinerated
The Pitiless performs his Round after 2 Titan turns
Then the other 2 Titans go, then the Pitiless, then the players can re-arrange their playing order
At the start of each Pitiless's Round, perform
Merciless Sun
If M11 is marked, see 0198
If R7 is marked, see 0199
When the first Titan dies, see 0200
After you deal the 3rd Wound, see 0201
After you deal the 6th Wound, see 0202
If all Titans die, see 0205
If you start the Primordial Round or your Titan turn adjacent to the Old Haunt, you are incinerated
The Old Haunt performs his Round after 2 Titan turns
Then the other 2 Titans go, then the Old Haunt, then the players can re-arrange their playing order
At the start of each Old Haunt's Round, perform
Merciless Sun
If you were on a Shaded space during any Sun Attack, destroy the Terrain tile that shaded that space, even if Indestructible
Add the new cards to the AI and BP I and II decks
Replace the AI and BP III Decks
Ignore the "do not escalate" rules of BP cards
If the text refers to the Pitiless, it applies to the Old Haunt
Mimetic Darkness: Draw AI cards from the bottom of the AI deck
Bloody Dalliance: If you Wound Blackbeak, but your total Power isn't twice or more than
AT
, after resolving the Attack, immediately
Heal 1
This undoes Crit response gains, like Loot and Cores, and triggers
even if Blackbeak was techincally killed (ignore the Mercy Rule)
If there are no BP cards in the Escalation decks, you lose the Battle
Goes For the Head:
Crit Evade Fail
Exhaust your Cryptex and gain a
CombatAction
or
MovementAction
Fatigue token
